com.enterprise_architecture.essential.importutility.data.global
Class ConfigurationPackage

java.lang.Object
  com.enterprise_architecture.essential.importutility.data.global.ConfigurationPackage

public class ConfigurationPackage
extends java.lang.Object

Class to manage the packaging of the Essential Import Utility configuration. Packages are saved as ZIP files that contain all the relevant configuration components

Author:
Jonathan Carter

          Constant value used to specify that the generated package file includes a timestamp

Constructor Detail

ConfigurationPackage

public ConfigurationPackage(java.lang.String theRootDirectory)
Constructor for the configuration packaging class.

Parameters:
theRootDirectory - the full path to the root directory in which this class will operate.
Method Detail

createConfigurationPackage

public java.lang.String createConfigurationPackage(boolean theIsAddTimestamp)
Create a configuration package in the configuration package location for the current configuration of the Import Utility

Parameters:
theIsAddTimestamp - = TRUE, then a timestamp is added to the package filename.
Returns:
the relative path and name of the created package

deployConfigurationPackage

public boolean deployConfigurationPackage(java.io.InputStream theConfigurationPackage)
Read and process the specified configuration package, unpacking it and deploying the included components into the live Import Utility configuration, ready to be used.
The current configuration is backed up to a configuration package before the deployment commences.

Parameters:
theConfigurationPackage - configuration package to use
Returns:
true on success or false if the package could not be deployed.

addToArchive

protected void addToArchive(java.util.zip.ZipOutputStream theTargetPackage,
                            java.io.File theSourceContent,
                            java.lang.String theParentDirectoryName,
                            boolean theIsAddDirContents)
Add the source content to the target archive package. If the source content is a folder, this in addition to its children are added to the package.

Parameters:
theTargetPackage - the target archive in which to add the source file or directory
theSourceContent - the file or directory to add to the archive
theIsAddDirContents - = true, any contained files and subdirectories are also added.

readFromArchive

protected boolean readFromArchive(java.util.zip.ZipInputStream theSourceArchive)
Read the specified configuration archive and write / deploy the contents to the configuration

Parameters:
theSourceArchive - the source archive containing a configuration component
